title: After Covid-19 Made Americans Better Tippers, Inflation Could Change That
sub_head: New data from Square suggest that inflation and a return to normal may mean less generous gratuities from some customers
body:
Consumers started tipping more during the Covid-19 pandemic, but that generosity may be slowing.
Earlier in the pandemic, Americans—many of whom were cooped up and saving money while their local restaurants were losing business—were willing to tip as much as 30%. Given that restaurant employee wages were so depressed, consumers were willing to help pick up the slack.
